perturbation.changed_text: C. Subject to the terms and conditions of the applicable content agreement with such Licensor, the Net Advertising Revenue shall be calculated on a quarterly calendar basis (the "Net Advertising Revenue Period") and shall be payable no later than one hundred and twenty (120) days after the termination of the preceding full quarter-annual period, i.e., commencing on the first (1st) day of January, April, July and October except that the first and last calendar periods may be "short," depending on the effective date of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: California law mandates specific payment deadlines for royalties and revenue sharing, and generally requires more prompt payment than 120 days. By extending the payment deadline to 120 days, the contract risks non-compliance, particularly if the underlying content agreements with Licensors require quicker royalty payouts. This creates a legal contradiction where the contractual timeline is longer than what might be legally permissible, potentially leading to disputes and legal challenges.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Labor Code Sections regarding payment of royalties and revenue sharing.
